law.catch_line: Requirement for cabinet to extend state deadlines by administrative regulations if federal deadlines are extended.

text.section: If the United States Department of Transportation extends the date by which all commercial drivers are required to have a commercial driver's license, the Transportation Cabinet shall by administrative regulation extend the effective date of KRS 281A.090 to match the extended federal date.

If the United States Department of Transportation extends the date for allowing the skills portion of the commercial driver's license test to be waived, the Transportation Cabinet shall by administrative regulation extend the effective date of the waiver to match the extended federal date.

If the United States Department of Transportation extends the date for allowing a state to issue an intrastate medical waiver, the Transportation Cabinet shall by administrative regulation continue to accept applications for medical waivers and, as appropriate, issue intrastate medical waivers until the extended federal date.

law.history: Created 1992 Ky. Acts ch. 274, sec. 11, effective April 7, 1992.
